definition: Mt Yulong or Jade dragon in Lijiang 麗江|丽江, northwest Yunnan
jade
dragon/CL:條|条[tiao2]/imperial
surname Long
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
surname Xue
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
surname Shan

sentences.english: Not far from the city are the snowy Yulong Mountain and the Tiger Leaping Gorge.
sentences.chinese: 離城不遠處有玉龍雪山和虎跳峽。

sentences.english: I was frozen solid by the snow on Yulong Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 我在玉龍雪山上被凍僵了。

sentences.english: I loved my trip to the Yu Long Mountain. I will never forget it!
sentences.chinese: 我愛玉龍雪山之旅，我永遠都不會忘記它。

sentences.english: Gorgeous Yu Long Xue Shan sets the background for the sea of relgious flags.
sentences.chinese: 壯麗的玉龍雪山，爲五彩經幡旗當背景。

sentences.english: Mount Yulong is also a glacier closest to the equator in the world.
sentences.chinese: 玉龍雪山還是全球距赤道最近的冰川。

sentences.english: The water house is a private house, located at the foot of snow mountain Yulong in Lijiang.
sentences.chinese: 淼廬是一座私人住宅，位於在麗江玉龍雪山腳下。

sentences.english: The last place we'll visit is Yulong Snowmountain.
sentences.chinese: 我們要參觀的最後一個地方是玉龍雪山。

sentences.english: A total of 90 species were found in the soil samples of the Yulong Mountains.
sentences.chinese: 在玉龍雪山共鑑定到90種土壤纖毛蟲。

sentences.english: I have never been to Jade Dragon Snow Mountain, and I hope I can visit there soon.
sentences.chinese: 我從未去過玉龍雪山，希望能早日前去。

definition: Namtso or Lake Nam (officially Nam Co), mountain lake at Nakchu in central Tibet
Himalayas
pinyin: Xi3 ma3 la1 ya3 shan1 mai4

Yalong Bay in Sanya 三亞|三亚[San1 ya4], Hainan

Xinduqiao town in Dartsendo county 康定縣|康定县[Kang1 ding4 xian4], Garze Tibetan autonomous prefecture, Sichuan
Arxan county level city, Mongolian Rashaant xot, in Hinggan league 興安盟|兴安盟[Xing1 an1 meng2], east Inner Mongolia
Goddess peak (Nepalese: Sagarmatha, Sky Goddess)/refers to Mt Chomolungma or Qomolangma (Tibetan), Chinese 珠穆朗瑪峰|珠穆朗玛峰/Mt Everest

fjord

Kumbum (Chinese Ta'er), monastery in Qinhai, formerly Amdo province of Tibet
shallows/shoal/sandbar

Huangguoshu waterfalls, Anshun 安順|安顺[An1 shun4], Guizhou
